dt: {bc}a structure enclosed (as by glass) and used for the cultivation or protection of tender plants
{bc}a clear plastic shell (such as a canopy) covering a section of an airplane
{bc}a compartment (as for a bombardier) enclosed by such a shell

shortdef: a structure enclosed (as by glass) and used for the cultivation or protection of tender plants
a clear plastic shell (such as a canopy) covering a section of an airplane; also : a compartment (as for a bombardier) enclosed by such a shell

dt: {bc}of, relating to, contributing to, or caused by the greenhouse effect

shortdef: of, relating to, contributing to, or caused by the greenhouse effect

dt: {bc}any of various gaseous compounds (such as carbon dioxide or methane) that absorb infrared radiation, trap heat in the atmosphere, and contribute to the {d_link|greenhouse effect|greenhouse effect}

dt.t: Water vapor is an important gas for the study of climate and weather because of its role as a natural {wi}greenhouse gas{/wi} as well as its relationship to clouds and precipitation.
Scientists now recognize tropospheric ozone—a component of smog—as a {wi}greenhouse gas{/wi} as well as an eye and lung irritant.

While it may not be possible to eliminate all {wi}greenhouse gas{/wi} emissions, it is possible to offset some of the emissions that do still occur. Offsetting involves supporting projects that reduce or sequester {wi}greenhouse gas{/wi} emissions in another location.
Livestock emit 14.5 percent of all {wi}greenhouse gas{/wi} emissions each year. Most of that is from cows.

shortdef: any of various gaseous compounds (such as carbon dioxide or methane) that absorb infrared radiation, trap heat in the atmosphere, and contribute to the greenhouse effect

dt: {bc}warming of the surface and lower atmosphere of a planet (such as Earth or Venus) that is caused by conversion of solar radiation into heat in a process involving selective transmission of short wave solar radiation by the atmosphere, its absorption by the planet's surface, and reradiation as infrared which is absorbed and partly reradiated back to the surface by atmospheric gases

shortdef: warming of the surface and lower atmosphere of a planet (such as Earth or Venus) that is caused by conversion of solar radiation into heat in a process involving selective transmission of short wave solar radiation by the atmosphere, its absorption by the planet's surface, and reradiation as infrared which is absorbed and partly reradiated back to the surface by atmospheric gases

dt: {bc}the warming of the Earth's atmosphere that is caused by air pollution
{it}The greenhouse effect{/it} occurs when warmth from the sun is trapped in the Earth's atmosphere by a layer of gases (such as carbon dioxide) and water vapor.

shortdef: the warming of the Earth's atmosphere that is caused by air pollution
